summary: This is a defense filing by Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney Jeffrey Pagliuca to Judge Alison Nathan, responding to government letters regarding subpoena requests for evidence including a journal, boots, and photographs. The filing argues the government is improperly handling evidence, selectively disclosing information, and interfering with Maxwell's defense investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case, whose defense team is filing this motion to obtain evidence including a journal, boots, and photographs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman representing Ghislaine Maxwell, who authored and submitted this filing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, to whom this filing is addressed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and alleged co-conspirator; the journal in question describes Accuser-2's interactions with him.

persons.name: Accuser-2
persons.context: An alleged victim represented by Boies, Schiller, and Flexner who kept a journal in 1996 describing interactions with Jeffrey Epstein; her journal is central to the subpoena dispute.

persons.name: Michael Baker
persons.context: Host of The Daily Podcast from The New York Times who interviewed Accuser-2 about her journal.

connections.description: Pagliuca is Maxwell's defense attorney filing this motion on her behalf.
Accuser-2 is an alleged victim who has sued Maxwell and participated in the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.
Maxwell is alleged to have been involved with Epstein's activities; the indictment references her interaction with Accuser-2 at Epstein's residence.
Accuser-2's journal describes her interactions with Epstein, whom she alleges abused her.

events.title: Maxwell's Subpoena Application
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell asked the court to issue a Rule 17(c) subpoena for evidence controlled by Boies, Schiller, and Flexner lawyers.

events.title: Defense Review of Physical Evidence
events.description: Maxwell and her lawyers traveled to New York to review all physical evidence, including original photographs, in person.

events.title: Accuser-2's Journal Entries
events.description: Accuser-2 kept a journal documenting her interactions with Jeffrey Epstein in New York during this period.

events.title: NY Times Daily Podcast Interview
events.description: Accuser-2 discussed her journal and experiences with Jeffrey Epstein on The Daily Podcast, mentioning using the journal to refresh her memory.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking a full journal from 1996 kept by Accuser-2, alleging the government only has selectively produced 7 photocopied pages and has not examined the remainder.
The government admitted it does not have the remaining journal pages and has made no effort to read them, yet claims they contain no relevant material.
The defense notes discrepancies between photocopies of journal entries produced in civil litigation versus criminal discovery, raising questions about potential manipulation.
Regarding requested boots, the government is attempting to 'moot' the defense subpoena by having the FBI secure them, which the defense argues interferes with Maxwell's investigation.
The defense argues the government has been inconsistent about which original photographs it possesses and failed to make them available during Maxwell's evidence review in April 2021.
